Quotes: All pain is either severe or slight, if slight, it is easily endured;if severe, it will without doubt be brief.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The limit of every pain is an even greater pain.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: There are some cases in which the sense of injury breeds not the will to inflict injuries and climb over them as a ladder, but a hatred of all injury.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Failure after long perseverance is much grander than never to have a striving good enough to be called a failure.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: There is nothing heavier than compassion. Not even one's own pain weighs so heavy as the pain one feels for someone, for someone, pain intensified by the imagination and prolonged by a hundred echos.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: A son can bear with equanimity the loss of his father, but the loss of his inheritance may drive him to despair.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: They certainly give very strange names to diseases.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Drunkenness is nothing but voluntary madness.
Author: Seneca
